pageContext.name: Emily Frazier

childMarkdownRemark.html: Emily Frazier is a Research Assistant for MITH's Unlocking the Airwaves and Broadcasting Audiovisual Data projects. She is a History MA and Master of Library & Information Science graduate student at the University of Maryland. Her research interests include discoverability in archives and linked data, as well as maps, cartography, and digital humanities. Outside of school and work, she enjoys needlepoint embroidery and spending time with her cat. Emily is a graduate of the University of Texas at Austin, where she earned her BA in Linguistics, Spanish, and the Plan II Honors Program. During undergrad, she worked with museum and archival collections doing cataloging and processing.

title: Graduate Research Assistant
pageContext.bio: Emily Frazier is a Research Assistant for MITH's Unlocking the Airwaves and Broadcasting Audiovisual Data projects. Her research interests include discoverability in archives and linked data, as well as maps, cartography, and digital humanities. Outside of school and work, she enjoys needlepoint embroidery and spending time with her cat. Emily is a graduate of the University of Texas at Austin, where she earned her BA in Linguistics, Spanish, and the Plan II Honors Program. During undergrad, she worked with museum and archival collections doing cataloging and processing.
